title: [GAMEPLAY] Azir's soldiers unable to attack when he is far away
body: The tooltip on Azir's W states that he is able to make the soldier attack even if he himself is not in auto-attack range of the target, but this is not always the case. It seems that when he is relatively far away from the soldier (roughly just outside his own auto-attack range if he were to attack the solder) he cannot order the soldier to attack, even if a minion or champion is within the small range circle around the soldier. I've played a few games with Azir and have been seeing thing pretty consistently. I would place the soldier in a minion wave, move back a bit, but still in the tether range so the soldier lives, and clicking on the minions will do nothing (Azir won't move to attack them, and the soldier won't attack them as well)

replies.body: Even if Azir is close enough so that the soldiers don't die, that doesn't mean that he can use the soldier to attack. You have to be within a certain range of the soldiers (I think it's like around 750 or 800 range) in order to use them to attack, but the range to just keep them alive is a bit larger than that.

I figured that might be the case, the tooltip on the ability should reflect that though. It currently says that he can attack regardless of the range and doesn't mention a limit at all. It would be nice if there was a range indicator and mention of this limit on the ability itself.
The soldier goes into an Idle animation when they are out of range from Azir. If Azir goes any further, they just die.
